conclusion: The problem involves determining how shadows A, B, C, and D change in position and size when the light source moves to the back left or right.
There are four objects: a blue alarm clock, an egg, a black box with a handle, and a white object with buttons and a handle. Each casts shadows labeled A, B, C, and D respectively.
Shadows are formed when an object blocks light, creating a dark area behind it. Their position and size depend on the position of the light source and the object.

The light source is currently coming from above, casting shadows directly below the objects. Shadow A is below the alarm clock, shadow B is below the egg, shadow C is below the black box, and shadow D is below the white object.
The problem specifies that the light source moves to the back left or right, requiring analysis of changes in shadow position and size.
If the light source moves to the back left, shadows will shift towards the right side and may become longer or shorter depending on the movement.
Currently, shadow A is directly below the alarm clock. If the light moves to the back left, shadow A will shift towards the front right and possibly extend more towards the front.
Currently, shadow B is directly below the egg. If the light moves to the back left, shadow B will shift towards the front right and possibly become longer.
Currently, shadow C is directly below the black box. If the light moves to the back left, shadow C will shift towards the front right.
